meanings.definition: Third person singular present of say.
meanings.sent3: The cat saith meow when hungry.
meanings.sent4: The wind saith secrets to the trees.

meanings.definition: Used in biblical and archaic language to indicate speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: The saith in the book was powerful.
meanings.sent2: His saith was heard by all.
meanings.sent3: The saith of the old scroll intrigued him.
meanings.sent4: Her saith echoed through the halls.
meanings.sent5: The saith of the prophet was revered.
